sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the "Drug Paraphernalia
As used in this Act, unless the context otherwise requires:
sections.text: As used in this Act, unless the context otherwise requires:

sections.heading: (a) Any person who keeps for sale, offers for sale, sells,
sections.text:
or delivers for any commercial consideration any item of drug
paraphernalia commits a Class 4 felony for which a minimum fine of
$1,000 for each such item shall be imposed. Any person 18 years of age or
older who sells or delivers for any commercial consideration any item of
drug paraphernalia to a person under 18 years of age is guilty of a Class 3
felony.

sections.heading: Exemptions. This Act does not apply to:
sections.text: Exemptions. This Act does not apply to:

sections.heading: (a) All drug paraphernalia is subject to forfeiture.
sections.text: (a) All drug paraphernalia is subject to forfeiture.

sections.heading: This Act is intended to be used solely for the suppression
sections.text:
of the commercial traffic in and possession of items that,
within the context of the sale
or offering for sale, or possession, are clearly and beyond a reasonable
doubt intended
for the illegal and unlawful use of controlled substances.
To this end all reasonable and common-sense inferences shall be drawn in
favor of the legitimacy of any transaction or item.

sections.heading: The provisions of any ordinance enacted by any municipality
sections.text:
or unit of local government which imposes the same or greater restrictions
or limitations upon the availability of drug paraphernalia as defined herein,
including the acquisition, sale or delivery of such items, are not invalidated
or affected by this Act.
